ygData.subject: Re: Educating the masses
ygData.msgSnippet: Have you killed Nillipus?  He s a brownie.  It might have affected your faction.  I ve only killed him a couple times, but it starts making me worry that the
ygData.messageBody:
Have you killed Nillipus? He's a brownie. It might have affected your
faction. I've only killed him a couple times, but it starts making me worry
that the Brownies will go hunting for me. Thanks for the info about
wandering Brownies.

Wenaddar of Cazic-Thule (Level 16.5 Bard)

I will never reach 17 if people don't stop getting me killed!

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [SMTP:Dean_Kimes@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, June 22, 1999 4:30 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Educating the masses
>
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> You wouldn't believe what some people think of Bards. I was in Lesser Fay
> last nite hunting for Crookstinger last nite, blast his elusive hide, when
> all of a sudden a passing cleric started healing me. I thanked him and
> told
> him he could save his mana as I was able to play a healing song that kept
> me
> in good shape. He sais he had no idea bards could heal themselves???
> Anyways we ended up teaming up for a bit of bandit bashing while we waited
> for Crookstinger to show his ugly mug. He finally did, but still no
> dagger.
> the cleric told me it was real nice not to have to blow all his mana after
> one lousy bandit cause he knew I could heal him of 100 pts before the next
> one showed up. I didnt have the heart to tell him that was without my
> mandolin.
>
> Now I have another name from the depths of Lesser Fay to add to my book of
> grudges. Some brownie named Bracken Underbrush, a high level druid,
> ambushed me as I headed back from the wood elf outpost to Greater Faydark.
> With SOW he was able to stay in range for some stunning spells and a lot
> of
> stings and blasts. Ouch, where the heck did this guy come from anyway?
> Have the brownies taken to wandering at the bandits behest? He assaulted
> me
> again on that hallowed hill but I was able to pop up a drum and race to
> the
> zone. He totally ignored the other 3 on the hill despite them being lower
> level and my never having killed a single brownie, faerie, pixie, or other
> diminutive humanoid. Some day Bracken, some day...
>
> Kitasi
> The mournful bard of Faydwer on E'ci
> "and no one shall work for money,
> and no one shall work for fame"
> "but each for the joy of the working,
> and each to his separate star..."
>
